text: well first of all can I just say a word
about yesterday which was a difficult
day and I'm grateful for the significant
support I had from colleagues but I've
also heard loud and clear the concerns
of those who didn't feel able to support
me and I know the concerns there are in
the House of Commons about this issue of
the backstop and that they do not want
it to be permanent and what I'll be
talking to European leaders about here
today is about what I think is we need
to get this deal over the line I've
already met me over at Kerr I'm going to
be addressing the European Council later
and I will be showing the legal and
political assurances but I believe we
need to assuage the concerns that
members of parliament have on this issue
now I know the eu-27 will also be
discussing no deal planning and indeed
the government in the UK is discussing
no deal planning but I think as I've
always said that the best arrangement
for everybody for both the UK and the EU
is for us to agree a deal and get this
deal over the line
yes I've said that you know I in my
heart I would love to be able to lead
the Conservative Party into the next
general election but I think it is right
that the party feels that it would
prefer to go into that election with a
new leader thank you know people sorry
to talk about days what I'm clear about
is the next general election is in 2022
and I think it's right that another
party leader takes us into that general
election my focus now is on ensuring
that I can get those assurances that we
need to get this deal over the line
because I genuinely believe it's in the
best interest of both sides the UK and
the EU to get the deal over the line to
agree our deal but I recognize the
strength of concern in the House of
Commons and that's what I will be
putting to colleagues today I don't
expect an immediate breakthrough but
what I do hope is that we can start to
work as quickly as possible on the
assurances that are necessary thank you
